snippet: As a Congressman in rural North Carolina, Mr. Rose worked to protect the tobacco industry and its farmers when political pressure on the industry was on the rise.
abstract: Charlie Rose, a former United States representative from North Carolina who fought to protect the tobacco industry and its farmers when political pressure on the industry was on the rise, dies at age 73.
lead_paragraph: As a Congressman in rural North Carolina, Mr. Rose worked to protect the tobacco industry and its farmers when political pressure on the industry was on the rise.

headline.seo: Rep. Charlie Rose, Ally of Tobacco Farmers, Dies at 73
headline.main: Representative Charlie Rose, Tobacco’s Friend in the House, Dies at 73
headline.print_headline: Charlie Rose, 73, Tobacco’s Friend in House
